entry.title: How the capacity planning works in warehouse management (public cloud)?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?

The client’s requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO

There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:

  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.

  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin

Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.

 

How the process can be mapped in sap public cloud warehouse management? please advise me on priority.

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt in Advance Production Integration in SA...
entry.content:
In an SAP S/4HANA Embedded EWM setup, production integration relies on Expected Goods Receipt (EGR) and inbound deliveries generated internally within EWM. Unlike decentralized systems, inbound deliveries are not pushed from ERP — they are triggered by confirming the manufacturing order and processed entirely within EWM.

So when using RFUI or /SCWM/GRPI, the system expects either:

  • an EGR document linked to the manufacturing order, or
  • a manually selected inbound delivery created from that EGR.

If neither exists or is selected, errors like “No expected goods receipt found for m” or “Indicators for selecting inbound deliveries and EGR are initial” will occur.

So the solution is

  • ensure EGR generation is active via BC Set /SCWM/DLV_INBOUND_PROD.
  • Confirm your production storage location is EWM-managed.
  • Use /SCWM/GRPI with “Expected Goods Receipt” checkbox selected.
  • Validate that document types INBM and item types IDPD are configured.
  • Assign a work center to a bin for RFUI to function properly.

entry.title: Re: How to add the Freight Charges during GRN ?
entry.content:
Some recommended approaches are

Use Unplanned Delivery Costs During Invoice Posting. With this approach, after GR, when the freight amount is known, post the invoice using Manage Supplier Invoices app. In the invoice, enter the freight amount in the “Unplanned Delivery Costs” field. SAP will allocate the cost to the material if valuation is allowed, Or post it to a price difference account. This method is clean, auditable, and works well for freight paid directly to the transporter.

The other option is to use a Separate Freight PO (Optional). If freight is frequent and managed by a logistics provider, create a Freight Framework PO. Post freight invoices separately using service PO or subsequent debit. This keeps freight accounting separate from material valuation and allows better tracking.

SAP standard behavior is partial GR handling, to proportionally allocate freight based on received quantity. If you want fixed freight per GR, configure the freight condition type with:

  • Calculation Type = B (Fixed Amount)
  • Scale Basis = B (Quantity)
  • Disable Quantity Conversion

This ensures freight is posted per GR event, not proportionally

In short, the summary is

The setting for cPAY is working fine, without the reversal check part.

entry.title: Re: Cancellation of Customer invoice in RV instead of AB
entry.content:
In standard SAP, when you cancel a billing document (like RV), the system can either create a new billing document with a reversal type (e.g., AB), or post the reversal within the same document type (RV), depending on configuration.

I could see the root cause of the issue is if the cancellation billing type is not explicitly set to AB, SAP may default to RV for reversal even if it is blank, and this is hard-coded. So go to VOFA, select your billing where the “Cancellation Billing Type” should be set to AB.

Coming to Posting Key, as you might be knowing, Posting Key 11 = Customer Credit Memo and Posting Key 12 = Invoice Reversal. So the root cause is the account determination procedure and billing document configuration influence which posting key is used. If the system treats the cancellation as a credit memo rather than a true reversal, it will use Posting Key 11. This can happen if the cancellation billing type is not properly mapped to use reversal logic in FI.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Establishing Accountability Across the Three Lines (of Defense) Model
entry.content:
As stated in the very first words of the introduction to the Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA) Three Lines Model – An Update of the Three Lines of Defense position paper: “Organizations are human undertakings”.

And since organizations need effective structures and processes to enable the achievement of their objectives, the intent of the Three Lines Model is to provide a framework that best assists them in this endeavour and that enables well-organized governance and risk management.

 To do so, the IIA has identified key stakeholders who need to collaborate to contribute to the creation and protection of value for the organization:

There is no doubt that this is a commendable intention, but it can prove difficult to implement and to monitor – especially in distributed organizations.

The question that we, GRC software providers, then often get is: how does your system help establish clear responsibilities, accountabilities, and oversight roles for managing risks, controls, and compliance across the enterprise? And subsequently of course, how does it help coordinate among key personnel to minimize gaps and eliminate unnecessary duplication of activities?

 

Aligning roles and responsibilities of each line

 

Whether it be a 3, 4, 5... or more lines of defense, the crucial element is to ensure that no risk falls through the cracks and that duplication of effort is reduced as much as possible. Or even better: completely eliminated and manual tasks automated.

 

First line (Operations)

 

 

For business users and managers involved in first line activities, SAP Process Control and SAP Risk Management integrate into the business process and supporting IT systems to help to identify, assess, and manage risks in their daily activities. These solutions also provide the capabilities to automate compliance and process checks but also risk indicators to raise discrepancies early on and implement a “by exception” approach where precise workflow tasks are triggered only when business expert inputs are required (compliance issue to investigate, negative risk trend to review, etc.).

 

Second line (Risk Management and Compliance)

 

For risk management and compliance functions, SAP Process Control and SAP Risk Management offer a consolidated risk universe for monitoring the risk level and response efficiency, but also a centralized repository for compliance obligations from where controls and checks can be documented and scheduled for assessment or testing. Providing a single source of the truth for risk and controls status of course also includes unified issue management to help resolve problems faster and improve accountability when anomalies are raised either by failed automated checks or by business users from the first line directly.

 

 

Third line (Internal Audit)

 

 

When it comes to the assurance function, SAP Audit Management supports the work of internal audit teams with a platform for planning, independent evaluation execution, and reporting of audit missions. Thanks to its integrated risk-based audit universe, it automatically retrieves audit-ready data from SAP Risk Management and SAP Process Control for real-time audit insights. This enables the third line to evaluate the effectiveness of risk management and control processes across the organization and to provide assurance to Management of course, but also to suggest improvements to the first and second lines.

 

Oversights (Governing Body)

 

Top-down and bottom-up interactive dashboards correlate data from all SAP solutions from Three Lines (SAP Process Control, SAP Risk Management, SAP Audit Management but also SAP Business Integrity Screening for pattern detection) and break down silos with a unified view across the organization. This 360-degree, real-time insight into compliance status, control effectiveness, and risk exposures allows business executives to make informed and faster decisions on risk mitigation and opportunities and supports them in fulfilling their oversight responsibilities effectively, ensuring the organization meets its strategic, operational, and regulatory goals while minimizing risks.

 

 

Enabling the Three Lines Model as a dynamic framework

 

As for the stakeholders, these modules need to work together to deliver the cohesion required to implement a three lines approach:

With data flowing across all modules, SAP solutions for Three Lines enable the roll-out of a dynamic framework, supported by integrated and automated risk-aware governance for regulatory compliance of course but also for organizational resilience:

What about you, how do you facilitate the collaboration between each line? I look forward to reading your thoughts and comments on this blog.

 And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content:
How does your ui5.yaml file look like?

Normally when I check my application if it doesn't work, I check the console first. In your case ui5 is loaded (component is loaded), so that's good news. Then I check the network tab, 40x and 500 errors are important to handle. If it is an ico, nothing to worry about. 

Check the preview  / response of the metadata.xml file.  You are working with RAP / Fiori Elements, so this might be the key to solutions or problems 🙂

Is the response ok? Check out the $batch jobs (you can inspect the response with UI5 Inspector very easily). I expect in your case no real issues, since you checked the backend (ST22 and /iwfnd/error_log).

Still not working? Try to analyse the code that dumps, set a breakpoint at the AppComponent.js file and reload your page. Try to find out what is missing. I expect something in your manifest file.

Still not working? Strip your manifest and focus only on the list report view. Remove all named models and try to stick to the bare minumum the app should work.,

Good luck!

Noël

entry.title: Moving Gmail Inbox Emails to Subfolders Using Message ID in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi  Everyone , I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation on a use case where I need to manage Gmail emails. The requirement is to identify an email in the Inbox using the unique Message ID provided by Gmail and then move this email from the Inbox to a custom subfolder within the Inbox. I have tried using the Move Email (Online) activity, but I am facing challenges as the activity does not seem to recognize the custom subfolder, and the process fails when I attempt to move the email using the Message ID. I would like to know the recommended approach for fetching Gmail emails based on Message ID and the correct way to configure the target folder path when moving emails into subfolders or labels. Any guidance, best practices, or configuration examples from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: User status without status number box is greyed out i...
entry.content:
Greetings,

if you are using phase model please refer to note https://me.sap.com/notes/3365558/E

Phase control codes and user status are not interchangeable. Hence, phase model enabled order types only allow phase control codes so that the combination with user status is not supported. 

You can also follow below links where similar discusions have been raised:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/user-status-for-maintenance-orders/qaq-p/12732300

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/new-phase-model-for-the-maintenance-processes-in-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13517755

Best regards, M.

entry.title: Query on using Virtual Hostnames in Windows servers
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

We are building new SAP systems on Windows[using virtual hostnames] to migrate current landscape which is also on Windows but uses physical hostname.

 

We are retaining old physical hostname as virtual hostname in new builds

 

As per note DIGITS, we have disabled DNS registry and used skipassource option for SAP system installations. Our network team has below questions for firewall and NSG settings to be adopted.

  1. changes done as part of note DIGITS are permanent? because DNS registry needs enabling for virtual hostname after cutover
  2. Is note DIGITS applicable for builds on Azure Cloud.
  3. Which IP is used as source for outbound connections as skipassource parameter is set and all outbound data goes through this IP. Share available article/note for the same 
  4. As per DIGITS IP and hostname should resolve to each other. If we set skipassource, for outbound SAP application data will it work as OS IP will be used to send out data
  5. In a distributed system though ASCS/ERS are using cluster IP and load balancer, for application servers we intend to use virtual hostnames, is this supported and points of DIGITS can be used.

 

We had a detailed discussion with our network team and checked all SAP Notes DIGITS,DIGITS,DIGITS and installation guide 

 

NW7XX_inst_abap_win_sql.pdf, but the answers are not clear.

 

Kindly, answer above questions for us to proceed further with builds and take required precautions.

 

regards

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SCM Consulting Solution Tools
entry.content: Does anyone else have experience with the tools? I would be interested in your feedback.

entry.title: Re: Query on using Virtual Hostnames in Windows servers
entry.content:
Hi Shashidhar,

Please refer to the following:

1. Changes done as part of note 1564275 are permanent.
2. note 1564275 applies to Azure Cloud as well
3. please use the physical ip of the server, you can check it by ipconfig.
   Please understand that it is pure Microsoft Windows Server query, please refer to note 15.
4. Yes it should work if all the settings are correct.
5. Please understand that note 1564275 does not apply to Windows Failover Clustering environments.
   So it is not supported and points of 1564275 can be used.

Best regards,
Joe
SAP support

entry.title: Re: How to delete Integration & Exception Monitoring of a...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

Kindly refer to Delete Monitoring Configuration guide under expert portal.

For Integration & Exception Monitoring,  it is necessary to delete the monitoring configuration for a service or system.

The deletion goes further than just a deactivation, as it removes all configuration from the service or system and sets its status back to "Not Configured" for Integration & Exception Monitoring.

  1. In the configuration tray, click on the name of the managed service or system
  2. The "Configuration of Services / System" screen opens
  3. In the "Configuration for Services / System" screen, select the row of the service by clicking on the row selector in the very first column.
  4. Click the button "Remove Configuration" in the upper right corner of the table.
  5. Confirm the pop-up.

Please kindly feel free to let me know when you still face the same.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Sunny

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Fiori Element ListReport initialLoad cannot be Disabl...
entry.content: According to documentation "Disabled" is correct: https://ui5.sap.com/#/api/sap.fe.core.InitialLoadMode

entry.title: Re: Fiori Element ListReport initialLoad cannot be Disabl...
entry.content:
According to documentation "Disabled" is correct: https://ui5.sap.com/#/api/sap.fe.core.InitialLoadMode

But maybe "Auto" works?

Also custom code can work here, just a idea, this is pseudo code, you need to adapt it:

// LR controller extension (ext/controller/ListReportExt.controller.js)
onAfterRendering() {
  const view = this.base.getView();
  const fb = view.byId("IDOFFILTERBAR")
  if (!fb) { return; }

  // ensure no live validation noise on load
  fb.setLiveMode(false);

  // once the user performs the first search, go live for the rest of the session
  fb.attachSearch(() => fb.setLiveMode(true));
}

entry.title: Re: Problems faced while using my SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
Hello Abhijit,

regarding problem 1): Please refer to What's New for SAP BTP ABAP environment: As of release 2508, for sub packages created in software component ZLOCAL, workbench requests are no longer required.

regarding problem 2):
This might happen because for OData V4 UI service bindings, the "Create" button is only enabled if the draft mode is activated in the behavior definition. Ensure that the behavior definition includes with draft; to enable draft functionality

Regarding concurrent.ExecutionException: Please make sure to not interact with the service binding while Unpublish/Publish operation in progress. Do not modify, close or refresh the Service Binding. I was able to successfully publish/unpublish my service binding with my trial account, it takes some time though as it is in trial system.

Regards,
Peter

entry.title: 2025 年第三季度 SAP 分析云“指南针”新功能亮点
entry.content:
在刚刚发布的 SAP 分析云 QRC3 版本中，指南针将上线两项新功能，进一步降低终端用户进行风险分析的难度。下面将为大家介绍这两个功能相对范围输入与冲突动因检测。

相对范围输入  

用户今后可将动因的不确定性以“相对值”形式录入，即以当前模型基线为参照设定偏移量。偏移量既可用百分比，也可用具体数值表示。在输入过程中，界面下方将同步显示对应的绝对值，便于即时核对。 

采用偏移量方式录入，一方面更贴合业务部门的表达习惯，便于准确捕捉假设；另一方面，同一影响幅度（如 +5%）可一键应用于多个动因，操作更加便捷。 

另有一项贴心设计：当方案发布时，系统会自动将用户输入的相对值转换为绝对值，若随后基于该结果创建私有副本，则这些数值将再次还原为相对范围，以兼顾结果浏览（公用方案）与方案建模（私有方案）的不同使用场景。 

冲突动因检测 

方案建模过程本身非常动态，用户通常需要以与思维同步的速度记录和建立各类假设。在此高速迭代过程中，极易因疏忽而产生相互冲突的动因设定，例如为存在重叠关系的动因同时赋予不确定性。典型情形是：在同一方案运行中，既为“欧洲营收”又为“德国营收”设定不确定性（德国隶属欧洲，二者存在层级重叠）。遇此情况，指南针将即时提示冲突，协助用户保持动因清单的精简、清晰与配置有效。 

通过上述两项全新功能，我们致力于进一步提升终端用户在方案建模过程中的效率，使业务人员能够更加轻松、直观地进行风险分析。 

如果您首次接触指南针功能，欢迎阅读以下博客，快速上手： 

  • 蒙特卡洛模拟入门
  • SAP 分析云指南针功能正式发布
  • SAP 分析云指南针分步详解（上）
  • SAP 分析云指南针分步详解（下）

 

原文作者：ChenNee

原文链接：https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/2025-q3-sap-analytics-cloud-compass-highlights/ba-p/14174928

entry.title: Unlocking the Power of Custom Test Variants and Test Data Containers for Test Automation
entry.content:
Test variants in automation tools allow you to define the exact input data used during test execution—think specific customers, materials, or document types that matter for your client or implementation.

 What is a Test Variant?
A test variant in Test Automation Tool for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud is a data configuration that feeds into your test script. It contains field-level values mapped to specific UI steps (e.g., Purchase Order Number, Material ID, Quantity).

You can have:
- Multiple variants per script (for regression across data sets)
- Reusable variants across test scripts
- Data-driven automation, where business inputs come from real scenarios

 Step-by-Step: Creating a Custom Test Variant
1. Open Your Test Plan: Navigate to the “Test Your Processes” app.
2. Go to ‘Variants’ Tab: Click Create Variant and select input fields.
3. Enter Test Data: Use business-relevant values (e.g., 1710 for Company Code, NL00 for Supplier).
4. Execute: Select the variant to your script and execute.

Enhancing Test Variants with the Test Data Container (Fiori App ID: F5404)
The Test Data Container (TDC) app provides a central place to define, store, and reuse test data across scripts and test plans. It's the backbone for consistent and scalable data management. Refer TDC Self Help document here

 Key Features of the Test Data Container:
- Centralized Repository: Define test data sets (containers) for different business processes.
- Reusable Inputs: Map containers to multiple test variants to avoid duplication.
- Process-Aware: Access standard containers relevant to your process.
- Preloaded Templates and Containers: SAP provides business area wise templates and ready-to-use containers based on scope items.

 How It Works with Test Variants:
- You create a TDC with relevant master/Organization data (e.g., customer, supplier, plant).
- Link the container to your test variant in the Test Process or Test Plan.
- The system auto-fills test fields from the Test Data container, reducing manual entry and errors.
- Updates to TDC reflect across all linked variants instantly.

Fig 1: TDC linkage to Test Plan

Fig 2: Linkage of TDC and Test Plan variant

 

Best Practices:
- Use clear naming for each container (e.g., TDC_DE_MaterialSet01).
- Keep TDCs versioned if your data evolves across testing cycles.
- Maintain different containers for localization, negative testing, and release regression.

Benefits of Using Test Data Container:

Feature

Benefit

Centralised Management

Avoids redundant data entry across variants

Scalability

Easily reuses business inputs across modules

Flexibility

Create containers for standard or custom use cases

Stability

Improves consistency in test execution outcomes

 

Conclusion
By combining Test Variants with the Test Data Container app (F5404), SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud customers can build resilient, reusable, and maintainable test automation landscapes. This capability ensures consistency across scripts, enhances collaboration, and aligns closely with DevOps principles.

 Coming Up Next:
“How to Debug and Troubleshoot Failures in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool”

entry.title: My sales order VA01 transaction timed out
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

My VA01 transaction timed out after pressing the SAVE button.

The ST22 log showed that the program MV45AFZA was triggered and the corresponding subroutine
USEREXIT_REFRESH_DOCUMENT caused it.

Below is the code snippet of the endless loop.

DO.
SELECT SINGLE * FROM vbak
WHERE vbeln = d_bapiso.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
clear vbak.
EXIT.
ENDIF.
ENDDO.

What is your proposed solution and what do you think is the rootcause?

Thanks,

New cloud guy

entry.title: Bellwethers: Key Indicators for Business - Road Cargo Transporation and Air Cargo Transportation
entry.content:
Businesses and investors often rely on bellwethers—key companies, industries, or indicators that provide early signals of broader economic trends. These economic indicators help decision-makers understand the state of the economy and make informed strategies. Bellwethers can take many forms: individual stocks, entire industries, or broader economic data points.

Bellwether Industries and Economic Insights

The real estate industry is a classic example of a bellwether. Rising home sales and property values indicate consumer confidence and financial security. Conversely, slowing sales may point to tighter financial conditions or rising borrowing costs.
Transportation, particularly road and air cargo, is another bellwether sector. These categories reflect supply chain health and consumer/business demand. FedEx, for instance, is widely used as an indicator of global commerce. A rise in FedEx shipments may indicate robust business activity, while a drop may hint at slowing demand.

SBN Network Trends: Road and Air Cargo

The Network Demand Trends dashboard reveals the previously hidden behavior of customers using SAP Business Network (SBN). Suppliers can identify trends and opportunities using SAP Business Network’s machine learning-driven commodity enrichment process. By analyzing aggregated network-wide data, suppliers can better understand spending patterns, category-level activity, and broader market dynamics.
Within the demand trends dashboard, transportation-related categories—especially road and air cargo—show promise as economic bellwethers.

Road Cargo Insights

Road cargo spend on the SBN shows seasonal spikes, particularly at year-end, complicating month-to-month or quarter-to-quarter analysis. Improvements to the dashboard to account for seasonality may enhance trend clarity.

Despite the seasonal noise, recent data is noteworthy:
• Q1 2025 road transportation spend: $186.01 million higher than Q1 2024
• Q2 2025 road transportation spend: $256.30 million higher than Q2 2024
These increases may reflect more than just fuel or shipping rate hikes. To validate, the U.S. Bureau of Transportation Statistics Truck Tonnage Index was consulted.

 It showed:

• Increased goods movement in Q1 2025 vs. Q1 2024
• Decrease in goods movement in Q2 2025 vs. Q2 2024
This indicates that while spending is up, actual freight volumes may not be keeping pace—potentially indicating higher costs or inefficiencies.

Air Cargo Insights

Air cargo on the network has displayed even greater volatility, possibly due to macroeconomic disruptions and global logistics instability.

Comparing quarters:
• Q1 2025 air cargo spend: $8.58 million higher than Q1 2024
• Q2 2025 air cargo spend: $61.27 million lower than Q2 2024
This mixed trend complicates conclusions about growth in the category.

Several external factors are shaping air cargo dynamics:
• Shifting Trade Routes
• Geopolitical Tensions
• Regulatory Changes
• Demand Fluctuations & Capacity Constraints
• Ocean Freight Uncertainty

Conclusion and Next Steps
Transportation spend—especially road and air cargo—provides important signals for broader economic activity. While the current demand trends dashboard only allow for short-term analysis, extending the solution to support year-over-year comparisons would greatly enhance our ability to detect economic shifts and identify bellwethers in real time.

Sources:

Bellwether in business: What it is and why it matters

Hey team,

entry.title: Re: howe to delete endpoints in CALM Landscape with sourc...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

When I check details of the screenshot, I notice that the "Source" of this tenant is "Imported" rather than "Manual" or "Registered" which means the tenant cannot be deleted manually.

See details under KBA 3248215 How to delete Service/Systems in SAP Cloud ALM

-> 

There are certain prerequisites for deleting systems/service (to enable the Delete button):

  • The Source of the system should be Registered or Manual

--

 in this case it cannot be deleted manually. It should get removed automatically by the next SLIS Import

We delete a tenant automatically with the landscape import when:
- it is marked as “Deleted” in the CLD
- it has the status "New" in the LMS, that is, there is no configuration for the tenant.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: Re: My sales order VA01 transaction timed out
entry.content:
Why this code in a form that should only refresh local customer data.

  • What is this D_BAPISO sales document? It will trigger an infinite loop if it doesn't (yet) exist in database.
  • It would be better to add a wait to the loop and limit the number of DO/ENDDO tries. If there is a failure, raise an abort error.

entry.title: Re: Completing Learning Journey over several Practice Sys...
entry.content:
Hello @oskarkallstrom ,

The Configuring Employee Central Learning Journey in LSC includes three learning modules: EC Core, Position Management, and EC Hands-On Workshop. Each module has its own dedicated practice system. We strongly recommend learners complete the exercises within the access period of the practice system. However, if, for any reason, this isn't possible, the exercises are designed to be flexible. They are structured to be as independent as possible. 

 For example, in the SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Core Academy, the only required exercises are exercises 1 and 2. After that, you can skip to any of the exercises you'd like to complete. 

 

So, if you had to re-enroll for another practice system, just make sure to complete Exercises 1 and 2 first before proceeding where you left off.

If your study time is limited, consider finishing the reading material first before moving on to the exercises. Regardless, there is no limit to how many times you enroll in a practice system. Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: Rendering of Document via service ADS failed
entry.content:
Hello @mbanggo 

Thank you for sharing the details.

The error “Rendering of Document via Service ADS failed” in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition typically comes from the Adobe Document Services (ADS) layer that handles form rendering. It is not specific to your custom templates.

A few key points,

  • If the system falls back to a standard form because the custom template is not set as active or is not linked correctly in Output Parameter Determination, ADS may fail to render it.
  • Please double-check in the Maintain Form Templates app that your custom form is active and assigned, and in Maintain Business Rules for Output that the correct template is picked up for each document type.
  • If the issue happens even when you use a standard template, it usually points to an ADS service issue or a connectivity timeout. In that case, the only resolution is to raise an SAP Incident under component S4CORE-OPM (Output Management).
  • For further analysis, you can check the Application Log  App F1873 – Display Application Log to see the detailed ADS error text.

Check SAP Help Documentation – Output Management in S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further information.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cancellation of Customer invoice in RV instead of AB
entry.content:
When cancelling SD invoices, SAP try to use the 'new' procedure (new for some years) if it fails it use the 'old' procedure. So you can get a different result.

  • If possible reset first FI clearing document via tcode FBRA to allow new procedure
  • Read KBA 3290691 - Error F5814 when reversing billing documents.

entry.title: Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 Downtime — Check Your Browser Strategy Today!
entry.content:
This blog post was prompted by a recent issue in SAP customer support for SAP Fiori apps. I want to share the background, hoping it helps prevent a similar situation in your environment.


SAP Browser and Platform Support

SAP's Product Availability Matrix (PAM) provides the single source of truth for SAP software releases, including platform availability on browsers and operating systems. Regarding SAPUI5, note that SAPUI5 is not a product of its own, so please check the PAM for the product you're using SAPUI5 with. For more information, see SAP Note 1716423.

Browsers constantly evolve across devices to offer new capabilities and address newly detected security issues. Upgrades of browsers may introduce changes that are not backward compatible, affecting SAPUI5 and SAP software behavior. Browser upgrades may also require specific platform or operating system versions for all end users. Vendors do not provide (security) updates for browsers or platforms that are out of maintenance, which then are severe risk to productive environments. Keep in mind that SAP has no control over browser upgrades, their capabilities, or maintenance duration.

In other words: In Web development, especially with browsers: "Never touch a running system" is *NOT* an option.


Browsers for SAPUI5

SAPUI5 applications in productive SAP products require a minimum browser version to ensure full availability and security. This also lets SAPUI5 use current industry standards, such as ECMAScript, to deliver a modern and intuitive experience for SAP Business Suite.


Based on my own experience in the SAPUI5 team, I can confirm missing this requirement is a real-life risk. My conversations with customer support colleagues confirm this: productive SAP customers experienced outages because end users worked with browsers that were out of maintenance. One example can be seen in SAP Note 3639059 - Blank home screen in SAP Fiori Launchpad - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, which prompted this blog post. Using an outdated browser, end users saw a blank screen; developers got an error "Promise.withResolvers is not a function" in the console. The resolution for such cases is to update to the latest browser version, which in some cases may even require a costly operating system upgrade for all business users.

Therefore, I recommend monitoring the SAP Product Availability Matrix (PAM) and specifically the SAPUI5 Browser and Platform Support.

entry.title: Re: IS NOT Null is not filtering the data for the null values in SAP Datasphere view
entry.content:
Hello @kalyanbw99 ... I had the same issue, and used this workaround:

CASE when LENGTH(CompanyCode) > 1 then CompanyCode else '' end

... of course this works only if your field usually contains strings longer than 1 char.

Otherwise this is probably no option for you.

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: My sales order VA01 transaction timed out
entry.content:
The VA01 transaction is timing out after pressing Save, and the ST22 dump indicates that a standard SAP user exit — USEREXIT_REFRESH_DOCUMENT in program MV45AFZA — is being triggered. While the exit itself is standard, it contains custom logic that appears to be causing an infinite loop. Specifically, the loop keeps trying to read from the sales order header table VBAK without finding a match, and without a proper exit condition, the system continues processing until it times out.

To resolve this, I recommend the following actions for the technical team:

Check whether the variable d_bapiso is correctly populated before the loop begins. If it's blank or invalid, the loop will never exit.
Ensure the loop has a proper exit condition, so it doesn't continue indefinitely when no matching data is found.
Consider replacing the loop with a single SELECT statement if the goal is simply to check whether a sales order exists. This would simplify the logic and avoid unnecessary processing.

Once these adjustments are made, the VA01 transaction should complete successfully without timing out.

entry.title: PS: CJE0 object value not the same with CJI3

entry.title: Accelerate Business Value with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
In today’s digital economy, data is no longer just an IT concern—it’s the foundation of every business decision. Organizations that can unify, govern, and activate their data are the ones best positioned to innovate, adapt, and grow.

SAP Business Data Cloud makes this possible. It connects SAP and third-party data in a single, governed fabric, applying principles like zero-copy sharing and data mesh to ensure clean, trusted, and AI-ready data at scale.

To help you unlock this value faster, we’re launching a new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI): SAP Business Data Cloud Core Skills

This multi-day, expert-led workshop equips your team with the skills and knowledge they need to start strong, accelerate adoption, and deliver business value from day one.

Why it matters

With SAP Business Data Cloud, you can:

  • Unify SAP and non-SAP data into a trusted foundation for analytics
  • Apply Intelligent Applications and Data Products to deliver outcomes faster
  • Simplify integration, including SAP Databricks connectivity
  • Future-proof your landscape with a roadmap designed for AI-driven insights

By the end of the workshop, your team will be able to confidently apply SAP Business Data Cloud to modernize analytics, reduce deployment time, and maximize return on your data investments.

Who should join 

This workshop is designed for all professionals responsible for shaping, integrating, and analyzing enterprise data, including business users, IT professionals, architects, and others.

What will you achieve

By participating, you will:

  • Understand business value – Learn how SAP Business Data Cloud extends SAP BW, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Master key capabilities – Learn Intelligent Applications, Data Products, and governance best practices
  • Accelerate solution delivery – Apply Intelligent Applications for faster results
  • Integrate with ease – Connect SAP and non-SAP data, including SAP Databricks
  • Be future-ready – Gain insights into the solution roadmap and adoption path
  • Hands-on Practice – Get the opportunity to practice what you are learning in your own tenant with direct support from our SAP experts

Workshop details 

  • Format: Multi-day remote workshop, led by SAP experts and offered in multiple languages
  • Seats: Limited to 30 participants per session

👉 Register here to secure your spot and explore the complete SAP Business Data Cloud enablement portfolio.

entry.title: Re: Purpose of "authorized to teach"
entry.content: Adding on this, when you open the Instructors tab for an item, you can assign Authorized Instructors. You’ll also see the option “Check Instructor Authorization.” If this option is selected, then when you schedule a class for that item, only the authorized instructors will be available for selection. This ensures that only approved instructors can teach that class.

entry.title: Re: PS: CJE0 object value not the same with CJI3
entry.content:
Why CJE0 and CJI3 shows different values is because

CJE0 often displays amounts in Controlling Area Currency (CAC) when the report is configured to show "Object Currency"; but in reality, it pulls from the CO totals table, which defaults to CAC if no specific object currency is maintained.

CJI3, on the other hand, reads directly from line item tables and reflects the actual Object Currency (OC) assigned to the cost object (e.g., WBS element or internal order).

So even though both reports say "Object Currency," they may be referencing different sources — one from totals (CJE0) and one from actuals (CJI3).

To answer your question, "Can it be change to get value from OC? How to make it?", the answer is YES but with some conditions.

  • In CJE0, go to the report definition and check the currency settings. If the report is set to use Controlling Area Currency, change it to Object Currency explicitly. However, SAP may still interpret "Object Currency" as CAC if the object doesn’t have a distinct currency maintained.
  • For WBS elements or internal orders, ensure the object currency is explicitly set in the master data. This is only possible if Controlling Area Currency = Company Code Currency — otherwise, SAP restricts object currency assignment.
  • If consistent object currency reporting is critical, rely on CJI3 or CJI5, which pull directly from line items and reflect actual transaction currency.

In short,

entry.title: Re: CO Production Order Issue in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Unfortunately, CO production orders are not supported in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This is because the cloud version emphasizes standardized processes and restricts certain classic functionalities — including CO production orders, which are typically used for simple internal production without full PP integration.

Some viable options depending on your customer's needs:

Use PP Production Orders via Scope Item 3F0. Even if the customer does not currently have PP, they can activate scope item 3F0 – Event-Based Production Accounting, which enables production order processing in the cloud. This includes Production order creation, Goods issue and receipt, Event-based WIP and variance postings. This is the recommended approach for proper WIP tracking and production accounting in the cloud.

Manual Production Orders (Without PP Master Data). SAP allows creation of manual production orders without reference to material master or BOM/routing. This is useful for Rework orders, Setup or maintenance work, Urgent customer-specific production. You will need to manually enter material, quantity, and dates — but it’s a flexible workaround.
